intro: Senecio inexpectatus, commonly known as the unexpected groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
